headline.main: RED ARMY SLOWED BY GERMAN BLOWS; Only Minor Gains Made as Foe Throws Fresh Forces Into Fierce, Spreading Battles

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Thursday, Dec. 2 -- The Germans have struck out with new vigor in every sector of the Russian front in a major bid to stem the Russian offensive, counter-attacking yesterday as many as fifteen times in one area and slowing the Red Army to minor gains along the 600-mile front.
abstract: USSR forces slowed by Gers north of Gomel, along Pripet River and in Dnieper River bend; USSR attempts to wrest main lateral communications from enemy control noted
